author: Duna M√°rquez
title: La DANA deja ya m√°s de 100 litros en la zona mallorquina de Ponent
text: Temporal La DANA deja ya m√°s de 100 litros en la zona mallorquina de Ponent Desde Emergencias piden a la ciudadan√≠a que extreme las precauciones Duna M√°rquez El temporal que [ha arrasado Valencia llega a Mallorca](/sociedad/2024/11/01/directo-ultima-hora-dana-azota-costa-mediterranea-sur-peninsula-110836433.html). Tras dejar precipitaciones intensas en Ibiza y Formentera, la DANA est√° descargando descargando con fuerza en parte de la isla.En la zona de Ponent se han registrado ya m√°s de 100 litros por metro cuadrado. Las intensas lluvias, adem√°s, han provocado inundaciones importantes en Calvi√†, donde la crecida del torrent de Galatz√≤ ha obligado adem√°s a cerrar al tr√°fico de un tramo de la Ma-101. Los municipios m√°s afectados por las lluvias son, de momento, Galilea, Puigpunyent, Andratx y Calvi√†. Precisamente en este √∫ltimo, se han producido algunas inundaciones, cortes de calles y desprendimientos en carreteras, que han obligado a movilizar a Polic√≠a Local y efectivos municipales. El ayuntamiento de Calvi√† ha informado del corte al tr√°fico de un tramo de la Ma-101, la carretera de Calvi√† a es Capdell√†, que se ha inundado por desbordamiento del torrente de Galatz√≥ y de varias v√≠as en Palmanova y Magaluf. La Polic√≠a Local y operarios municipales trabajan en las zonas afectadas. Se espera que en las pr√≥ximas horas la dana se desplace por gran parte de Mallorca, dejando importantes precipitaciones a su paso. M√°s de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora La Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a recuerda que Mallorca se encuentra en alerta naranja por precipitaciones acumuladas de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora, llegando a acumularse 120 litros por metro cuadrado en algunas zonas de la isla en pocas horas. Las lluvias se mantendr√°n hasta el s√°bado 2 de noviembre, alarg√°ndose el aviso naranja hasta primera hora de la ma√±ana. Con el avance de las horas la alerta desaparecer√°, pero las precipitaciones se mantendr√°n a lo largo del d√≠a. Parques, cementerios y pasos peatonales, cerrados El paso peatonal del paseo Mar√≠timo de Palma entre el Palacio de Congresos y el Parc de la Mar permanece cerrado este viernes por el mal tiempo. As√≠ lo ha informado el departamento de Carreteras del Consell de Mallorca en un mensaje en redes recogido por Europa Press. Cabe recordar que en Palma, desde las 14.00 horas de este viernes est√°n cerrados los parques y los cementerios. El Govern pide "m√°xima prudencia" Ante la emergencia meteorol√≥gica para este d√≠a de Tots Sants, el Govern balear ha reclamado ‚Äúm√°xima prudencia‚Äù a los ciudadanos ‚Äúlas pr√≥ximas horas y d√≠as‚Äù por la alerta naranja decretada. Se recomienda que se tomen precauciones y mantenerse informado de la predicci√≥n meteorol√≥gica m√°s actualizada. Las actividades habituales y al aire libre pueden verse alteradas. El Servicio de Emergencias 112 ha activado el √çndice de Gravedad 1 (IG1) del Plan Meteobal por lluvias y tormentas en Mallorca y Menorca. El paso peatonal del paseo Mar√≠timo de Palma entre el Palacio de Congresos y el Parc de la Mar permanece cerrado este viernes por el mal tiempo. As√≠ lo ha informado el departamento de Carreteras del Consell de Mallorca en un mensaje en redes recogido por Europa Press. Cabe recordar que en Palma, desde las 14.00 horas de este viernes est√°n cerrados los parques y los cementerios. author: Chris Nee
title: Florida State Day 1 of Spring Practice: Mike Norvell, RB Kam Davis, and LB Juice Cryer provide insight
text:
TALLAHASSEE -- Florida State head coach Mike Norvell and others discussed the first day of spring practice for the Seminoles. Following Norvell's time at the podium, running back Kam Davis and linebacker Juice Cryer both spoke in breakout sessions.
Updates were provided in the comment section of this article. They can be found here.
Video from all three speakers is below:

author: Ramon Tomey; Jul
title: Dr. Carrie Madej ordered to pay $1.3M for negligence and wrongful death
text:
A Tennessee court has sided with the family of a Tennessee man who was treated with a potent mix of hydrogen peroxide for Wuhan coronavirus (COVID-19) infection, awarding his heirs $1.3 million in damages.
In a May 19 decision, Tennessee Circuit Court Judge Michael Pemberton sided with the heirs of 80-year-old Stefan Suto, who died after receiving an experimental hydrogen peroxide treatment for COVID-19 by Dr. Carrie Madej. Pemberton awarded Suto's estate, with his daughter Jana Sutoova Bennun as executrix, $1 million in punitive damages and $181,000 in compensatory damages.
He also ordered that Jana, in her capacity as an individual plaintiff, be paid $100,000 in compensatory damages and $50,000 in punitive damages. All in all, Madej was ordered to pay $1.33 million in damages, alongside all court costs taxed against her.
Jana and her husband Steve Bennun, Suto's son-in-law, believed they were acting in his best interest under Madej's guidance. However, Suto died from hemolytic anemia caused by toxic peroxide exposure. According to court documents, Madej administered nebulized and intravenous hydrogen peroxide, before the 80-year-old's condition rapidly declined.
Despite pleas for further medical intervention, Madej allegedly refused, prompting the family to seek alternative care in Florida. But this was too late ‚Äì Suto passed away on Dec. 23, 2021.
The lawsuit by Suto's heirs alleged negligence and wrongful death. Madej ‚Äì who surrendered her Georgia medical license in 2023 ‚Äì never responded to the claims.
Suto's ordeal began when he and his family developed flu-like symptoms that they suspected were COVID-19. They turned to Madej, also an advocate of health freedom, for help. The family knew Madej from their forays into the health freedom movement, as they even hosted content about it on their YouTube channel.
During the height of the COVID-19 pandemic, hydrogen peroxide was used as a therapy by alternative healthcare providers. But the case involving Suto's death at the hands of Madej underscores the dangers of such therapies if not done properly. His family members allege the treatments "[caused agonizing pain and [the] decline of Stefan's health condition](https://www.justiceforstefansuto.org/) to a point of no return."
Despite the civil judgment favoring his heirs, Suto's family said the victory provides little solace. "They turned their backs on us," Steven lamented.
OutrageDepot.com has more similar stories.
Watch this video about the use of nebulized hydrogen peroxide, the improper use of which unfortunately caused the death of Stefan Suto.
This video is from the EnergyMe333 channel on Brighteon.com.
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->prosecution and prosecutors

author: VNExplorer
title: Parents ask for medical cannabis to treat children with severe epilepsy - but are offered brain surgery by the NHS first
text:
Several families say their children were offered the 'insanely invasive procedure'
Children with severe epilepsy have been offered brain surgery by the NHS before medicinal cannabis, parents have revealed.
Several families have told the Mail their children were offered the ‚Äòinsanely invasive procedure‚Äô which involves detaching one side of the brain from the other and can cause sight loss.
One mother declined the operation, which costs the NHS up to ¬£33,400, and requested medicinal cannabis oil ‚Äì which was legalised five years ago and has proven effective with epileptic children.
The oils are administered orally every day and three children in the UK have NHS prescriptions, with successful results.
But other youngsters with similar conditions have been denied it, leaving parents paying up to ¬£2,000 a month to get the drug privately, while others can‚Äôt access it at all.
Luci Griffin‚Äôs son Alfie, 13, (pictured together) was diagnosed with intractable epilepsy six years ago and the family have so far been denied medicinal cannabis on the NHS. But last year doctors offered to carry out a hemispherotomy on Alfie, which would involve temporarily removing a piece of his skull to operate on his brain
The family are currently buying a high-concentrate CBD oil online, which costs them ¬£300 a month, but Alfie‚Äôs condition isn‚Äôt improving. He can no longer go to school and Mrs Griffin has had to stop work to become a full-time carer (stock photo of cannabis concentrate oil)
Luci Griffin‚Äôs son Alfie, 13, was diagnosed with intractable epilepsy six years ago and the family have so far been denied medicinal cannabis on the NHS.
But last year doctors offered to carry out a hemispherotomy on Alfie, which would involve temporarily removing a piece of his skull to operate on his brain.
The family said they were warned it carried ‚Äòa risk to life‚Äô, that Alfie could lose his peripheral vision and would need weeks of rehabilitation to learn to walk again.
Mrs Griffin said: ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt want to have to turn to him and say we know it didn‚Äôt work‚Ä¶ I want to say we‚Äôve done everything Alf, we did everything we could ‚Äì why wouldn‚Äôt we try medicinal cannabis first?‚Äô
The family, from Peterborough, have been refused Epidiolex on the NHS and private clinics that prescribe other oils cannot help.
In October the Mail revealed two families were smuggling cannabis oil from the Netherlands back in suitcases as the pharmacy which delivered their private prescription didn‚Äôt have enough stock.
Mrs Griffin said getting the drug privately may not even be an option as they would struggle to keep up with large monthly payments.
‚ÄòEven if we could [get it privately], how long can we sustain ¬£2,000 a month? Not for long because we‚Äôd have to sell the house,‚Äô the mother said.
The family are currently buying a high-concentrate CBD oil online, which costs them ¬£300 a month, but Alfie‚Äôs condition isn‚Äôt improving. He can no longer go to school and Mrs Griffin has had to stop work to become a full-time carer.
She said: ‚ÄòWe are absolutely stuck. We‚Äôre alone. We have no support.‚Äô
Families say they pay anything between ¬£400 to ¬£2,000 a month to get medicinal cannabis privately (stock photo of a scientist checking hemp plants in a greenhouse)
The Mail has spoken to two other families whose epileptic children were offered brain surgery.
‚ÄòYou can‚Äôt reverse brain surgery, so it seems like madness,‚Äô one mother said.
Caroline Gisbourne‚Äôs son Mitchell, 16, had the procedure before medicinal cannabis was legalised in 2018 but it didn‚Äôt work and is now successfully using the oils.
She said: ‚ÄòIf I had known about medicinal cannabis oils before, there‚Äôs no way I would have put him through the operation.‚Äô
Costs of brain surgery to the NHS depend on patients‚Äô age and the complexity of the procedure but are typically ¬£7,800 to ¬£33,400.
Families say they pay anything between ¬£400 to ¬£2,000 a month to get medicinal cannabis privately.
An NHS England spokesman said: ‚ÄòThe decision to proceed with surgery‚Ä¶ would be a joint one taken by a clinical team and a patient‚Äôs family and/or carers.‚Äô

author: El Caribe
title: Justicia Social eleva nuevas l√≠deres a su Direcci√≥n Nacional
text: | | ESCUCHA ESTA NOTICIA Santo Domingo, RD. ‚Äì Como una muestra del compromiso por reivindicar los derechos de las mujeres y construir una sociedad m√°s justa, igualitaria e inclusiva, el partido Justicia Social (JS) anunci√≥ la elevaci√≥n de nuevas integrantes que formar√°n parte de la Direcci√≥n Nacional de esta organizaci√≥n. As√≠ lo dio a conocer el presidente de JS, Julio C√©sar Valent√≠n, en la reciente reuni√≥n de ese organismo del partido, en la que destac√≥ que estas integraciones van en concordancia con la causa del feminismo como pilar fundamental de la misi√≥n pol√≠tica que han asumido desde sus inicios. Las mujeres que pasar√°n a formar parte de la Direcci√≥n Nacional por su trabajo, dedicaci√≥n y aportes en distintas √°reas, son: Milagros M√©ndez, Nurcis Yamilca Garc√≠a Celestino, Rosa Caraballo, Gregoria Soriano (Mary Coquito), Jenifer Sim√©, Susana Mart√≠nez, Marcelina Henr√≠quez (Milly) y Jazm√≠n Vicente, quien adem√°s ser√° la titular de la Secretar√≠a de G√©nero y Diversidad. Por m√°s derechos, participaci√≥n e inclusi√≥n Desde sus inicios, Justicia Social ha proclamado que es una organizaci√≥n pol√≠tica que postula como fundamento ‚Äúla transparencia, justicia social, inclusi√≥n y no discriminaci√≥n‚Äù, as√≠ como la defensa por una sociedad equitativa, en la que se reconozcan, valoren y promuevan los derechos de las mujeres. Este postulado es plasmado en la Declaraci√≥n de Principios del partido, en la que afirman ser una organizaci√≥n de car√°cter feminista, entendiendo el feminismo como forma de lucha por la igualdad de derechos entre mujeres y hombres. Dicha declaraci√≥n ha sido coherente con el ejercicio pol√≠tico de esta joven organizaci√≥n, al incentivar consecuentemente la presencia y el poder de las mujeres dentro del partido, fortaleciendo con ello el porcentaje de participaci√≥n femenina en la pol√≠tica nacional. Nuevas integrantes Milagros M√©ndez, es una profesional multifac√©tica con experiencia en periodismo, locuci√≥n, producci√≥n de radio y televisi√≥n, as√≠ como en asesoramiento en comunicaci√≥n pol√≠tica y corporativa. Adem√°s, se desempe√±a como docente universitaria y relacionista p√∫blico. Actualmente, forma parte de la Secretar√≠a de Comunicaciones del Partido Justicia Social. Nurcis Garc√≠a, es una estudiante de Derecho y comunicadora comprometida con el bienestar de la colectividad. Ha sido elevada a la categor√≠a de miembro del comit√© nacional del Partido Justicia Social, donde trabaja incansablemente para contribuir al √©xito de su partido. Jennyfer Sime, es una profesional del Marketing Estrat√©gico y la Publicidad de Impacto Positivo con experiencia en el sector privado de Rep√∫blica Dominicana y Colombia. Como co-fundadora y Directora de Marca en EMDES Foundation, lidera iniciativas de alto compromiso social. Actualmente, ejerce como presidenta de la circunscripci√≥n 2 de Santo Domingo Este por el partido Justicia Social, ampliando as√≠ su compromiso c√≠vico despu√©s de haber incursionado en la pol√≠tica como candidata a Regidora de esta demarcaci√≥n en 2024. Yazmin Vicente, es una activista social comprometida con el bienestar y la inclusi√≥n de grupos vulnerables. Desde ni√±a, colabora con organizaciones como la Iglesia Cat√≥lica, Unicef y Plan Internacional. A los 14 a√±os fund√≥ y lider√≥ la Red Juventud Vibrante, beneficiando a m√°s de 8,992 j√≥venes. Despu√©s del terremoto de Hait√≠ en 2010, dej√≥ su empleo en una multinacional para trabajar como voluntaria con ¬´Un techo para mi pa√≠s¬ª en Chile y Rep√∫blica Dominicana. Ha participado activamente en movimientos sociales como la lucha por Los Haitises, La Barrick Gold y la educaci√≥n. Milit√≥ en el Partido de la Liberaci√≥n Dominicana y actualmente es titular de la Secretar√≠a de G√©nero, Diversidad e Inclusi√≥n del Partido Justicia Social. Es Licenciada en Publicidad por la Universidad APEC y presidenta honoraria de la Fundaci√≥n Almas de Amor. Gregoria Soriano Vidal, conocida cari√±osamente como ¬´Mari Coquito¬ª, es una destacada luchadora social y educadora. Con experiencia como regidora y Vicealcaldesa del municipio Monte Plata, ha dedicado su vida a servir a su comunidad y promover el bienestar de sus habitantes. Marcelina Henr√≠quez, conocida como Milly, abogada e ingeniera industrial. Ha sido parte de varias organizaciones comunitarias y sin fines de lucro, acumulando 40 a√±os de trabajo social y pol√≠tico. En las elecciones del 18 de febrero fue candidata a regidora por el distrito municipal Santiago Oeste. Susana Mart√≠nez posee una extensa trayectoria como educadora, as√≠ como un destacado papel como activista social y pol√≠tica. En febrero de 2024, particip√≥ como candidata a regidora por el partido Justicia Social en el municipio Santo Domingo Este. Rosa Caraballo es una joven profesional y emprendedora que encuentra en el partido Justicia Social la plataforma ideal para su crecimiento pol√≠tico y para realizar contribuciones significativas a los sectores m√°s vulnerables. Cuenta con m√∫ltiples capacitaciones en escenarios internacionales.

author: RT en Espa√±ol
title: Biden vuelve a afirmar falsamente que su hijo muri√≥ en Irak
text: VIDEO: Biden llama a los padres de una militar fallecida y les cuenta una historia falsa sobre su propio hijo El presidente estadounidense, Joe Biden, [volvi√≥](https://www.ajc.com/news/georgia-news/president-biden-calls-parents-of-slain-reservist/34e04744-fa90-409f-8256-6f296a772fab/) a confundir las circunstancias de la muerte de su hijo mayor, Beau, durante una llamada telef√≥nica con la familia de Kennedy Ladon Sanders, soldado fallecida d√≠as atr√°s en Jordania. Intentando dar consuelo a los parientes de la mujer tras el [ataque](https://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/497260-tres-soldados-estadounidenses-mueren-docenas-heridos) del domingo pasado con un dron contra Torre 22, un peque√±o puesto de avanzada estadounidense en Jordania, el mandatario decidi√≥ compartir una historia sobre su hijo. "Pues le dir√© una cosa, eso significa mucho, mucho para m√≠", expres√≥ Biden al informar que Kennedy Sanders va a ser ascendida a sargento a t√≠tulo p√≥stumo. "Mi hijo pas√≥ un a√±o en Irak: as√≠ es como lo perd√≠", concluy√≥ el presidente. Sin embargo, en el transcurso de la conversaci√≥n, Biden pareci√≥ recordar que Beau no falleci√≥ mientras serv√≠a en el Ej√©rcito. "Mi hijo Beau viv√≠a cerca de un pozo de quema en Bagdad. √âl padeci√≥ glioblastoma del tumor cerebral, y lo perd√≠ tambi√©n", se√±al√≥. Anteriormente, el jefe de Estado en muchas ocasiones [confund√≠a](https://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/444631-biden-hijo-perder-vida-irak-cancer) la verdadera causa de la muerte de su hijo. Beau Biden s√≠ [particip√≥](https://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/444631-biden-hijo-perder-vida-irak-cancer) en dicho conflicto b√©lico entre 2008 y 2009, pero muri√≥ de c√°ncer cerebral en 2015, en el hospital militar Walter Reed en la ciudad estadounidense de Bethesda, Maryland.

author: Gary Washburn
title: Celtics leave fans green around the gills, but manage to extend Pistons‚Äô losing streak to 28 games - The Boston Globe
text:
The feeling was more relief, not celebration. The Celtics walked off the floor Thursday after being pushed to overtime by a team that hasn‚Äôt won in two months, knowing they had staved off embarrassment and realizing it took their best second-half effort to prevail.
The Detroit Pistons were understandably desperate, the talk of the NBA because of a record-breaking losing streak. They punched the Celtics first and often before their NBA-best opponent finally awoke, and used some clutch plays from Kristaps Porzingis and Derrick White to win, 128-122, in overtime.
Coming back from a 19-point halftime deficit, the Celtics rallied and then held off a determined Pistons club which has lost 28 consecutive games, tied for the most in NBA history. (The Pistons can break the record against Toronto on Saturday.)
Advertisement
They didn‚Äôt play like a team that hasn‚Äôt won since Oct. 28, attacking the paint, grabbing offensive rebounds, and hitting threes against a Celtics team that looked exhausted and distracted after a successful West Coast road trip.
Get Breaking Sports Alerts Be the first to know the latest sports news as it happens, and get the Globe's most interesting reporting right to your inbox. Enter Email Sign Up When Detroit‚Äôs Jalen Duren tipped in a miss and the Pistons led, 66-45, in the second quarter, boos were audible at TD Garden. The home team looked flat and erratic, and something would have to change at halftime.
Joe Mazzulla and his team had to go back to the drawing board at halftime. Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff In the Boston locker room, Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla showed White video of his first-half miscues. The guard also changed shoes after slipping multiple times in the first half. The result was 21 points on 8-for-10 shooting in the second half and overtime.
When Mazzulla saw this game looming, especially as Detroit‚Äôs losing streak continued, he envisioned one of the tougher games of the season.
‚ÄúEverybody comes into a game like this and it‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòOh, the Celtics are playing the Pistons, so they should win the game.‚Äô They look at the record and create this emotional mindset that this is easy,‚Äù Mazzulla said. ‚ÄúYou watch five or six Detroit Pistons games and you see how hard they play and how talented they are, and just because they‚Äôre a team [that‚Äôs on a losing streak] doesn‚Äôt mean they haven‚Äôt been in 10 close games and could have won if the ball bounced their way.
Advertisement
‚ÄúEach loss they‚Äôre playing harder because they want to win. And it‚Äôs going to happen.‚Äù
Kristaps Porzingis, who sparked impressive wins over the Kings and Lakers, also dominated after halftime, scoring 29 of his 35 points. That included the clinching bucket, when he resembled a 7-foot-3-inch wide receiver, catching a lead pass from Jayson Tatum for a thunderous dunk and a 123-117 lead with 45.2 seconds left.
ü¶Ñ pic.twitter.com/ZnUaRXMnaV
‚Äî Boston Celtics (@celtics) December 29, 2023 Finally, the Pistons, who rallied late in the fourth quarter to force overtime on six consecutive points from Jaden Ivey, were done. Ivey and Duren combined for 13 of Detroit‚Äôs season-high 19 offensive rebounds, as it stayed close with 31 second-chance points.
‚ÄúThey came out really aggressive, really desperate, and it‚Äôs tough to play against a team like that,‚Äù Porzingis said. ‚ÄúThey almost have nothing to lose. They‚Äôve already been losing so many games in a row and what better chance to come out and look strong against one of the best teams in the league. They did that in the first half. We knew it was going to have to be a war in the second half against them. We gave everything we had and we were able to put them away.‚Äù

Playing on a sprained left ankle he said remains swollen, Tatum shot just 11 for 31, but dished out 10 assists along with 7 rebounds and 5 steals as the Celtics held Detroit to 36.8 percent shooting after it shot 61.4 in the first half.

‚ÄúTo their credit, they are a young, athletic team,‚Äù Tatum said. ‚ÄúThey put pressure on us every time a shot went up. They did a good job of that. Everything that could have went wrong essentially went wrong in that first half. We were still motivated going into the second half. We knew we had to stop turning the ball over. We kind of picked up our intensity on the defensive end and that gave us life and energy on the offensive end.‚Äù
Jaylen Brown sat out Thursday with a back bruise after his Monday collision with LeBron James. With Tatum playing 43 minutes and the Celtics exerting so much energy to edge the Pistons, they will have to muster up enough guile to come back Friday against the Raptors.
‚ÄúWe learned more from [the Detroit] game than we did probably from playing the four games on the West Coast trip,‚Äù Mazzulla said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an opportunity to build a mindset and toughness. We had everything to gain; how about the stress and level of anxiety you felt in that arena today? To me, we gained a ton from the game.‚Äù
